title: A day in the French court where asylum seekers plead their case
description: Every year, in its modern premises in the eastern Paris suburb Montreuil, the French national asylum court hears the life stories of thousands of foreigners seeking refuge in France and tries to verify them.

title: Syria and Turkey warm relations with first official meeting
description: Under the leadership of Russia, the Syrian and Turkish defense ministers met Wednesday, December 28, in Moscow.

title: France and Spain to require Covid tests for China passengers
description: After a rapid rise in coronavirus infections in the country, France and Spain join the lengthening list of nations requiring travelers arriving from China to show negative Covid-19 tests.

title: British MP targeted by reparations demand over Caribbean slavery
description: Barbados wants to nationalize a sugar plantation owned by Richard Drax, a wealthy member of the British Conservative Party and descendant of a family of colonists enriched by the slave trade on the island.

title: In southeastern Tunisia, the shipwreck of young migrants who left for Europe has fueled the population's anger
description: Three months after the death at sea of 17 young people attempting to cross the Mediterranean, residents of Zarzis are continuing to demand 'the truth.'

title: José Antonio Ocampo: 'Creditors must play a critical role in providing debt relief for low-income countries'
description: The Colombian finance minister notes that a high number of poor and emerging countries are at risk of default in 2023.

title: Detention facilities for minors in Italy called into question after spectacular escape
description: A spectacular escape has drawn attention to a sector with diminishing resources.

title: European leagues to honor Pelé with pre-match tributes
description: Football leagues in England, Spain, Italy, France will honor Pelé who died Thursday, December 29, at the age of 82.

title: Teen prodigy Wembanyama is named MVP in French league's All-Star game
description: Victor Wembanyama, 18, became the youngest MVP in the French league's All-Star game.

title: Airbnb prices in France have been skyrocketing since 2019
description: In France, between August 2018 and August 2022, the average nightly rate for accommodation increased by 16.4%.

title: Leading activist Marina Silva returns as Brazil's minister of the environment
description: President Lula, who will be inaugurated on January 1, celebrated his reunion with the official whose first stint at the ministry (2003-2008) was marked by bold policies fighting deforestation.

title: For France, year marked by heat waves ends with excessively hot December 31
description: Weather forecasts predict new temperature records on December 31, with 2022 becoming the country's hottest year on record.

title: Trump's tax returns released after long fight with Congress
description: The former president and business mogul's taxes from 2015 to 2020 have been made public in the midst of multiple investigations into his financial activity.

title: Michelle Mone scandal captivates Britain
description: The atypical member of the House of Lords is suspected of having pocketed £29 million of public money thanks to a contract awarded by the British government at the start of the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Janet Yellen: 'Supply chain risks have challenged our economic growth'
description: Over-concentration, geopolitical and security risks, and violations of human rights are threatening the global economy, warns the US Secretary of the Treasury.

title: Noah Baumbach's 'White Noise' puts contemporary malaise under the spotlight
description: The film, which sees an academic, played by Adam Driver, and his family forced to evacuate after a toxic chemical spill, cultivates the strangeness of Don DeLillo's novel, which inspired it.

title: Satellite constellations: In search of new rules for space
description: France is calling for a law to be adopted at an international level that would oblige stakeholders in the sector to pollute less.

title: Netanyahu government sworn in under opposition and protesters' boos
description: Several thousand people demonstrated in Jerusalem and Tel Aviv against the new coalition described as 'fascist.'

title: The garbage orbiting above our heads
description: 'Race to the stars' (4/4). Space near Earth is cluttered with 36,000 objects larger than 10 centimeters in diameter, threatening to collide with an increasing number of satellites.

title: Israel's democracy has become an illusion
description: The new Israeli government is sympathetic to Jewish extremists and the ultra-Orthodox and plans to expand settlements, perpetuating a domination that should come at a political and diplomatic price.

title: Joseph Stiglitz: 'The Road to Fascism'
description: In 2023, writes the Nobel laureate in economics, the greatest threat to the economy and beyond will be political.

title: Putin promises to strengthen military ties with China
description: The Russian president also invited his Chinese countepart to Moscow next spring.

title: In Kyiv, a treatment center cares for the needs of traumatized soldiers
description: Ten months after the war began, and even longer for those who fought in the Donbas since 2014, numerous Ukrainian soldiers are suffering from anxiety, depression and long-lasting psychological trauma due to Russia's incessant artillery fire.

title: At the Musée Guimet in Paris, Wang Keping finds beauty in nature's accidents
description: The Chinese sculptor has been given a 'Carte Blanche' for an exhibit running until March 6, 2023.

title: 'Pelé is dead, football loses its king': World media pay tribute to 'immortal'
description: After the Brazilian's death on Thursday, December 29, newspapers around the world saluted the 'supernatural footballer' he was.

title: 'In West Africa, a midwife is often forced to fulfill the duties of three people'
description: Dr. Adam Ahmat, head of the human resources department at WHO's Regional Office of Africa, argues in favor of increased recruitment to deploy health workers to rural areas, where they are desperately needed.

title: France's 100,000 Ukrainian refugees still struggle to get by
description: As the conflict enters its 11th month, access to housing and employment remains arduous for Ukrainians exiled across France. With many of them not speaking French, they struggle to integrate.

title: Myanmar court convicts  Suu Kyi again for corruption, 7 years added to her prison term
description: The court’s latest action means the former leader has a total of 33 years to serve in prison following a series of prosecutions since the military toppled her elected government in February 2021.

title: 'When Pelé walked on the Moon'
description: Writer and former journalist Pierre-Louis Basse, a lover of the game, comments on the 'crazy beauty' of Pelé's actions that the memory 'delights in remembering'.

title: 'Pelé's meteoric rise to fame quickly made him a symbol whose impact went far beyond the field of sports'
description: Pelé was not yet 18 years old when he revealed himself at the 1958 World Cup in Sweden. His longevity and his ability to repeat exploits earned him a unique place in the pantheon of football – and well beyond, writes historian Clement Astruc.

title: Dorothy Iannone, artist and pioneer of the feminist struggle, has died
description: The American dared to openly show female sexuality and shared pleasure. This led to her being censored several times. She died on December 26 at the age of 89.

title: China's Covid-19 outbreak raises fear of medicines shortages in France
description: A large proportion of the active ingredients contained in medicines consumed in France are manufactured in China, where a Covid-19 surge could affect its production.

title: In Italy, Giorgia Meloni declares war on wild boars
description: In response to their worrying proliferation, the government has authorized the hunting of ungulates in urban areas and the consumption of their meat.

title: Naspers, the South African media giant that made its fortune betting on Chinese tech conglomerate, Tencent
description: Founded in 1915, South Africa's largest media group has a stake in Tencent worth more than $100 billion, and is increasing its tech investments.

title: New York's first legal recreational marijuana dispensary opens its doors
description: New York City mayor Eric Adams believes that the historic milestone 'represents a new chapter for those most harmed by the failed policies of the past.'

title: Ten video games to look forward to in 2023
description: 'Zelda,' 'Starfield' and 'Diablo IV'... Le Monde's Pixels department has selected the ten most promising releases of the next 12 months.

title: Russian airstrike leaves most of Ukraine without power days before New Years
description: On Thursday morning, blasts were reported across Ukraine – including in Kyiv, Kharkiv and Lviv – leaving three people killed and six wounded, including a child.
